ground_truth: They head into the forest, and BN now leads the escapees as they mount a rise. Lewis treads on a hidden land mine, and Diaz clamps a hand over his mouth as more troops dismount from the back of the lorry. The lorry moves on. Louis is wide-eyed in shock as Diaz whispers to him while Reese looks about. Michael cuts at the bloody wound, and Louis bites on a cloth. Soldiers get off a lorry with the tracker dogs, which are set after the scent and they lead their handlers in a rapid pursuit, followed by a large body of their colleagues. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy run up a rocky slope, but Sarah stumbles in the dirt, prompting Rambo to run back to help her up while School Boy moves up front. Michael and the mercenaries carry Lewis on a hastily-constructed stretcher, and the dogs lead their handlers. On the rocky path, School Boy stops to listen in a craggy crevice as Rambo starts to tear a strip from Sarah's shirt, which he ties around his boot. School Boy tosses Rambo an explosive while Lewis' party looks around in horror. The commander's truck stops, and via a walkie-talkie, the commander screams orders at an armed patrol boat on the river. The grey patrol boat flies the Burmese flag, and the captain signals to his helmsman, who fires up the engine. A handler offers a tracker dog a sniff of clothing. Rambo runs through the undergrowth with a strip of Sarah's clothing on his boot, and the troops seem to be gaining on him as he runs through a carpet of dry brown leaves. A lorry pulls into a clearing and more troops dismount. Rambo heads through the forest at full tilt, skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree where he takes the claymore explosive and launches it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and rips the clothing strip from his boot. He pulls a round metal disc, which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that he ties around the cloth, and with another glance in the direction of the dogs, he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with leaves before taking off into the forest. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush, and a small dog with beady eyes, tan fur, and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns, causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree, where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch, prompting the wide-eyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: They proceed into the woodland, and BN presently guides the fugitives as they ascend a slope. Lewis steps on a concealed land mine, and Diaz clamps a hand over his mouth as additional soldiers alight from the back of the truck. The truck carries on. Louis is wide-eyed in shock as Diaz murmurs to him while Reese surveys the surroundings. Michael slices at the bloody injury, and Louis bites on a cloth. Troopers get off a truck with the tracking canines, which are set after the scent and they lead their handlers in a swift chase, followed by a large group of their comrades. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy dash up a stony incline, but Sarah falters in the soil, prompting Rambo to rush back to aid her up while School Boy moves ahead. Michael and the mercenaries bear Lewis on a hastily-constructed litter, and the canines lead their handlers. On the stony trail, School Boy pauses to listen in a rugged crevice as Rambo begins to rip a strip from Sarah's shirt, which he ties around his boot. School Boy tosses Rambo an explosive while Lewis' group glances around in dismay. The commander's vehicle halts, and via a walkie-talkie, the commander shouts commands at an armed patrol craft on the river. The grey patrol craft flies the Burmese banner, and the captain signals to his helmsman, who starts up the engine. A handler presents a tracking canine a whiff of apparel. Rambo dashes through the thicket with a strip of Sarah's apparel on his boot, and the soldiers seem to be advancing on him as he races through a layer of dry brown foliage. A truck pulls into a clearing and more soldiers alight. Rambo proceeds through the woodland at full speed, skidding to a stop beside a gnarled tree where he takes the claymore explosive and positions it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and tears the apparel strip from his boot. He pulls a round metallic disc, which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of cord that he ties around the cloth, and with another glance in the direction of the canines, he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with foliage before taking off into the woodland. The canines and their handlers pause by the bush, and a small canine with beady eyes, tan fur, and a white beard sniffs around foliage and ferns, causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree, where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the limb, prompting the wide-eyed and terrified handlers to swiftly pull the excited canines away as a soldier kneels to examine the ground.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The forest is headed into by them, and the escapees are now led by BN as a rise is mounted. A hidden land mine is tread on by Lewis, and his mouth is clamped over by Diaz as the back of the lorry is dismounted by more troops. On moves the lorry. Shock is shown in Louis' wide eyes as whispers are made by Diaz to him while Reese looks about. The bloody wound is cut at by Michael, and a cloth is bitten on by Louis. A lorry is gotten off by soldiers with the tracker dogs, which set after the scent and lead their handlers in a rapid pursuit, followed by a large body of their colleagues. A rocky slope is run up by Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy, but Sarah stumbles in the dirt, causing Rambo to run back to help her up while up front is moved by School Boy. Lewis is carried by Michael and the mercenaries on a hastily-constructed stretcher, and their handlers are led by the dogs. On the rocky path, an explosive is tossed to Rambo by School Boy while looks of horror are made by Lewis' party. The commander's truck is stopped, and orders are screamed by the commander via a walkie-talkie at an armed patrol boat on the river. The Burmese flag is flown by the grey patrol boat, and the helmsman is signaled by the captain to fire up the engine. A sniff of clothing is offered to a tracker dog by a handler. Through the undergrowth runs Rambo with a strip of Sarah's clothing on his boot, and he seems to be gained on by the troops as he runs through a carpet of dry brown leaves. Into a clearing is pulled a lorry, and more troops dismount. Through the forest at full tilt heads Rambo, skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree where the claymore explosive is taken by him and launched in the limbs of the roots. In the direction of his pursuers is glanced by him, and the clothing strip is ripped by him from his boot. A round metal disc is pulled by him, which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that is tied by him around the cloth, and with another glance in the direction of the dogs, a priming pin is pulled by him from the bomb and the explosive is covered with leaves before he takes off into the forest. The bush is halted by the dogs and their handlers, and a sniff around leaves and ferns is made by a small dog with beady eyes, tan fur, and a white beard, causing looks at each other by the handlers. Along the tree looks one of the soldiers, where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch, prompting the excited dogs to be quickly pulled away by the wide-eyed and terrified handlers as the ground is inspected by a soldier kneeling.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: They enter the forest, with BN leading the escapees up a rise. Lewis steps on a hidden mine, and Diaz silences him as more soldiers dismount the lorry, which moves on. Louis, shocked, hears Diaz whisper while Reese surveys the area. Michael tends to Louis' wound, who bites on a cloth. Soldiers disembark with tracker dogs, rapidly pursuing them. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy ascend a rocky slope; Sarah trips, and Rambo helps her as School Boy leads. Michael and others carry Lewis on a makeshift stretcher, dogs guiding their handlers. On the rocky path, School Boy pauses to listen, and Rambo tears Sarah's shirt to tie around his boot. School Boy throws Rambo an explosive as Lewis' group is horrified. The commander orders a river patrol boat via walkie-talkie. The boat, flying the Burmese flag, sets off. Rambo runs with Sarah's fabric on his boot, pursued closely through dry leaves. A lorry arrives, and more soldiers dismount. Rambo speeds through the forest, stops by a gnarled tree, and sets a claymore explosive. He removes the cloth from his boot, ties it to the mine, covers the explosive with leaves, and runs into the forest. The dogs and handlers pause, a small dog sniffing around. One soldier notices the Tall Boy Missile lodged in the ground, prompting handlers to quickly retreat with the dogs, as a soldier inspects the area.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: They enter the forest with BN leading. Lewis steps on a land mine, silenced by Diaz, as more troops dismount the lorry. Shocked, Louis listens to Diaz while Reese surveys. Michael tends Lewis' wound as soldiers with tracker dogs pursue rapidly. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy climb a slope; Sarah falls, Rambo aids her, and School Boy advances. Michael's team carries Lewis; the dogs continue tracking. On a rocky path, School Boy listens in a crevice; Rambo tears Sarah's shirt to tie his boot. He receives an explosive from School Boy while Lewis' group watches in fear. The commander orders via walkie-talkie as a patrol boat flies the Burmese flag and starts its engine. A handler lets a dog sniff clothing. Rambo, with Sarah's strip on his boot, runs through the undergrowth; troops gain on him. More troops disembark in a clearing. Rambo stops beside a tree, sets a claymore, and hides it with leaves, then flees. The dogs halt, sniff around leaves, and handlers exchange glances. A soldier notices the Tall Boy Missile, prompting handlers to pull the dogs away as a soldier inspects the ground.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
They proceed deeper into the dense, shadowy forest, and at this point, BN assumes the role of leader, guiding the escapees as they carefully make their way up a gradual rise. During this tense moment, Lewis inadvertently steps on a concealed land mine, triggering a moment of alarm. Diaz swiftly places a firm hand over his mouth to stifle any potential outcry just as additional troops begin to disembark from the rear of the lorry. The vehicle continues on its way, rolling forward steadily. Louis, now with eyes wide in shock, listens intently as Diaz murmurs to him in a low voice, while Reese scans the surroundings with heightened vigilance. Meanwhile, Michael diligently attends to the bloody wound, skillfully cutting away at it, while Louis, enduring the pain, bites down hard on a cloth to suppress his cries. 

Elsewhere, soldiers are seen alighting from a lorry, accompanied by tracker dogs that are immediately set on the trail. These dogs, trained to pick up the scent, guide their handlers in a swift and relentless pursuit, and they are soon joined by a substantial contingent of their comrades. Rambo, alongside Sarah and School Boy, makes a hurried ascent up a rugged, rocky slope. However, amid the frantic pace, Sarah loses her footing and stumbles in the dirt. Without hesitation, Rambo doubles back to offer his assistance, helping her to her feet, as School Boy advances ahead. Michael, together with the mercenaries, strategically transports Lewis on a hastily-assembled makeshift stretcher, continuing their arduous retreat as the dogs forge ahead, pulling their handlers onward.

On the treacherous rocky path, School Boy pauses momentarily to listen intently within a craggy crevice, attuned to any signs of pursuit, just as Rambo begins to tear a strip from Sarah's shirt, which he adeptly ties around his own boot for camouflage. School Boy then skillfully tosses an explosive to Rambo, while the rest of Lewis' group looks around in horror at the dire situation they find themselves in. The commander's truck comes to an abrupt stop, and through the scratchy transmission of a walkie-talkie, the commander vehemently shouts orders to a heavily armed patrol boat patrolling the river. This grey patrol boat, prominently displaying the Burmese flag, is under the command of a captain who promptly signals his helmsman to start the powerful engine. Meanwhile, a handler offers a tracker dog a piece of clothing to sniff, reinforcing their trail.

Rambo, now sprinting through the dense undergrowth, has a strip of Sarah's clothing attached to his boot, a ruse to divert the scent. The pursuing troops seem to be closing in on him as he rushes over a rustling carpet of dry brown leaves. Soon, a lorry pulls into a clearing, and additional troops quickly disembark, bolstering their numbers. Racing at full speed through the forest, Rambo slides to a sudden halt beside a large, gnarled tree where he carefully places the claymore explosive, skillfully securing it among the tree roots. He casts a quick glance in the direction of his pursuers before tearing the strip of clothing from his boot. With urgency, he extracts a round metal disc, which is securely fastened to the body of the mine by a length of twine, tying it meticulously around the cloth. With another quick glance towards the advancing dogs, he pulls the priming pin from the explosive device, meticulously covering it with leaves before sprinting off into the forest once more.

Behind him, the diligent dogs and their handlers come to a temporary halt by the bush. A small dog, with beady eyes, tan fur, and a distinctive white beard, sniffs around the leaves and ferns, prompting the handlers to exchange concerned glances. One soldier peers along the tree line, observing the rusty grey outline of the Tall Boy Missile, which is lodged precariously in the ground and leaning ominously against a branch. This discovery causes the wide-eyed and visibly terrified handlers to swiftly pull the excited dogs away, as another soldier kneels down to cautiously inspect the ground, fully aware of the potential danger lurking beneath the surface.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As they proceed deeper into the thick, shadow-filled forest, the dense canopy overhead casts eerie shadows on the forest floor, and at this pivotal moment, BN takes on the role of leader. He steps forward to guide the group of escapees, carefully leading them as they navigate their way up a subtly inclining path. During this tense sequence of events, Lewis, with unintentional carelessness, steps on a hidden land mine, which immediately triggers a moment of heightened alarm and fear. In a quick and decisive move, Diaz places a firm hand over Lewis' mouth to stifle any potential outcry that could give away their position, just as additional troops start to disembark from the back of the lorry. The vehicle continues on its journey, moving forward with a steady, unrelenting motion. With eyes wide and filled with shock, Lewis listens intently as Diaz murmurs softly to him, while Reese remains on high alert, vigilantly scanning the surrounding area. Meanwhile, Michael focuses intently on the task at hand, diligently attending to the bloody wound by skillfully cutting away at the affected area, as Lewis, enduring the intense pain, bites down hard on a piece of cloth to suppress any involuntary cries.

Elsewhere, soldiers are observed alighting from the lorry, and they are accompanied by tracker dogs that are immediately set on the trail. These dogs, expertly trained to pick up even the faintest scent, guide their handlers in a swift and relentless pursuit, and soon they are joined by a substantial contingent of their comrades. Rambo, moving swiftly alongside Sarah and School Boy, makes a hurried ascent up a rugged and rocky slope. However, amid the frantic pace of their escape, Sarah loses her footing and stumbles in the dirt. Without a moment's hesitation, Rambo doubles back to offer his assistance, pulling her back onto her feet, while School Boy continues to advance ahead. Michael, together with the mercenaries, strategically transports Lewis on a hastily assembled makeshift stretcher, continuing their arduous retreat as the tracker dogs forge ahead, pulling their determined handlers forward.

On the treacherous rocky path, School Boy pauses momentarily to listen intently within a craggy crevice, attuned to any signs of pursuit echoing through the terrain, just as Rambo begins to tear a strip from Sarah's shirt, which he adeptly ties around his own boot in an effort to create camouflage. School Boy then demonstrates his skill by tossing an explosive device to Rambo, while the rest of Lewis' group looks around in horror at the dire and desperate situation they find themselves in. Meanwhile, the commander's truck comes to an abrupt stop, and through the scratchy transmission of a walkie-talkie, the commander vehemently shouts orders to a heavily armed patrol boat that is patrolling the nearby river. This grey patrol boat, prominently displaying the Burmese flag, falls under the command of a captain who promptly signals his helmsman to start the powerful engine. Meanwhile, a handler offers a tracker dog a piece of clothing to sniff, reinforcing their trail and aiding their relentless pursuit.

Rambo, now sprinting with urgency through the dense undergrowth, has a strip of Sarah's clothing attached to his boot, using it as a strategic ruse to divert the scent trail. The pursuing troops seem to be closing in on him, their presence palpable, as he rushes over a rustling carpet of dry brown leaves. Soon, a lorry pulls into a clearing, and additional troops hurriedly disembark, significantly bolstering their numbers. Racing at full speed through the forest, Rambo suddenly slides to a halt beside a large, gnarled tree. There, he carefully places the claymore explosive, skillfully securing it among the tree roots. He casts a quick, assessing glance in the direction of his relentless pursuers before tearing the strip of clothing from his boot. With a sense of urgency, he extracts a round metal disc, which he then securely fastens to the body of the mine by a length of twine, tying it meticulously around the cloth. Casting another quick glance towards the advancing tracker dogs, he pulls the priming pin from the explosive device and meticulously covers it with a thin layer of leaves before sprinting off into the depths of the forest once more.

Behind him, the diligent tracker dogs and their handlers come to a temporary halt by the bush. A small dog, with beady eyes, tan fur, and a distinctive white beard, sniffs around the leaves and ferns, prompting the handlers to exchange glances filled with concern. One soldier peers intently along the tree line, observing the rusty grey outline of the Tall Boy Missile, which is lodged precariously in the ground and leaning ominously against a branch. This troubling discovery causes the wide-eyed and visibly terrified handlers to swiftly pull the excited dogs away, while another soldier kneels down to cautiously inspect the ground, fully aware of the lurking danger beneath the surface.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As they make their way into the dense forest, BN takes the lead among the escapees, guiding them as they carefully navigate and ascend a steep rise. In a sudden, heart-stopping moment, Lewis accidentally steps on a hidden land mine, triggering a tense atmosphere where Diaz swiftly reaches out and clamps a hand over Lewis's mouth to prevent any noise from revealing their position, just as more troops begin to disembark from the back of a lorry nearby. The lorry then continues on its path, leaving Louis in a state of shock, his eyes wide with fear and panic, as Diaz leans in closer to whisper words of reassurance or instruction while Reese remains vigilant, scanning their surroundings for any immediate threat. Meanwhile, Michael focuses on attending to a grim situation, using a sharp tool to cut into a bloody wound, a procedure that causes Louis to bite down hard on a cloth to muffle his cries of pain. As soldiers dismount from a second lorry, they bring with them tracker dogs, which, with their keen sense of smell heightened, are set loose to pick up the scent. These dogs, eager and determined, immediately lead their handlers in a fast-paced pursuit, supported by a large contingent of their fellow soldiers. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy race up a challenging, rocky slope, when suddenly Sarah loses her footing and stumbles in the dirt. Without hesitation, Rambo rushes back down to assist her, offering a hand to lift her back onto her feet, while School Boy takes the lead, advancing further up the slope. Simultaneously, Michael and the other mercenaries laboriously carry Lewis on a makeshift stretcher cobbled together in haste, all while the dogs continue guiding their handlers ever forward. As they progress along the rugged path, School Boy pauses, listening intently for any sounds amidst the craggy crevices, just as Rambo begins to tear a strip from Sarah's shirt. This piece of fabric is deftly tied around his boot for reasons yet unknown. In a coordinated move, School Boy tosses an explosive device over to Rambo, while from their vantage point, Lewis's group looks around, horror-stricken by the impending danger. Elsewhere, the commander's truck grinds to a halt, and with urgency, he barks commands into a walkie-talkie directed at an armed patrol boat stationed on the river. This boat, displaying the Burmese flag, is manned by a captain who quickly signals to his helmsman, prompting him to start the engine and prepare for action. One of the dog handlers presents an article of clothing to a tracker dog, allowing it to catch the scent. Meanwhile, Rambo is sprinting through the thick undergrowth, the strip of Sarah's clothing still affixed to his boot, and the soldiers are seemingly closing in on him as he races across a bed of dry, rustling brown leaves. A lorry arrives at a clearing, where more troops rapidly disembark, ready to join the chase. Rambo, maintaining his rapid pace, plunges deeper into the forest until he reaches a halt beside an ancient, gnarled tree. Here, he carefully takes the claymore explosive, strategically launching it into the crook of the tree's roots. He casts a quick, assessing glance in the direction of his pursuers before yanking the cloth strip from his boot. With urgency, he extracts a round metal disc attached to the mine's body with a piece of twine, which he fastens around the cloth. Another wary glance toward the approaching dogs prompts him to remove the priming pin from the bomb, then expertly camouflages the explosive with a layer of fallen leaves before dashing off into the forest once more. The dogs and their handlers arrive hot on his trail, only to come to an abrupt stop near the bush. One particular small dog, characterized by its beady eyes, tan fur, and a distinctive white beard, sniffs vigorously around the foliage and ferns, prompting the handlers to exchange concerned glances. One soldier's gaze shifts along the tree line, where the imposing, rusty grey form of the Tall Boy Missile is nestled into the ground and ominously leaning against a tree branch. This sight sends waves of terror through the handlers, whose eyes widen with fear, causing them to urgently haul the excited dogs away, just as another soldier kneels down to closely inspect the ground for any further signs of danger.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The group heads into the forest with BN leading the escapees over a rise. When Lewis accidentally steps on a hidden land mine, Diaz quickly silences him as troops disembark from a lorry, which then moves on. While Lewis is in shock, Diaz whispers to him as Reese remains vigilant. Meanwhile, Michael cuts Lewis's wound, and Lewis bites on a cloth to endure the pain. Soldiers deploy tracker dogs that rapidly lead their handlers in pursuit, supported by a large contingent of troops. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy scramble up a rocky slope, but when Sarah stumbles, Rambo aids her while School Boy advances. Michael and the mercenaries transport Lewis on a makeshift stretcher, staying ahead of the pursuing dogs. On the rocky path, School Boy pauses to listen as Rambo tears a strip from Sarah's shirt and ties it around his boot. School Boy throws an explosive to Rambo as Lewis's group anxiously surveys their surroundings. At the river, a commander instructs an armed patrol boat via walkie-talkie to assist in the pursuit. As the boat, flying the Burmese flag, powers its engine, a handler refreshes a dog's scent with clothing. Rambo runs through the undergrowth with Sarah’s clothing on his boot, pursued closely by troops. Upon reaching a gnarled tree, he skillfully sets a claymore explosive and removes the clothing strip from his boot. Rambo primes the bomb, concealing it with leaves before resuming his flight. The dogs and their handlers pause by the bush, alarmed by the presence of a Tall Boy Missile lodged in the ground, prompting the handlers to retreat with their dogs as a soldier inspects the area.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They head into the forest, an expansive and dense area known for its treacherous terrain and hidden dangers, and BN now leads the escapees as they mount a rise. Lewis, unaware of the land plagued by remnants of past conflicts, treads on a hidden land mine, and Diaz quickly clamps a hand over his mouth as more troops dismount from the back of the lorry, a military vehicle commonly used for transporting soldiers and equipment. The lorry moves on. Louis is wide-eyed in shock as Diaz whispers to him, urging silence, while Reese looks about, scanning for any sign of pursuit. Michael, a seasoned field medic, cuts at the bloody wound, and Louis bites on a cloth to stifle his cries. Soldiers get off a lorry with the tracker dogs, renowned for their keen sense of smell, which are set after the scent and they lead their handlers in a rapid pursuit, followed by a large body of their colleagues. Rambo, a former Special Forces soldier known for his survival skills, Sarah, and School Boy run up a rocky slope, but Sarah stumbles in the dirt, prompting Rambo to run back to help her up while School Boy moves up front. Michael and the mercenaries carry Lewis on a hastily-constructed stretcher, a makeshift device demonstrating their resourcefulness, and the dogs lead their handlers. On the rocky path, School Boy stops to listen in a craggy crevice as Rambo starts to tear a strip from Sarah's shirt, which he ties around his boot to mask their scent. School Boy tosses Rambo an explosive, a critical moment showcasing their precarious situation, while Lewis' party looks around in horror. The commander's truck stops, and via a walkie-talkie, a vital tool for communications in the field, the commander screams orders at an armed patrol boat on the river. The grey patrol boat, a symbol of military enforcement, flies the Burmese flag, and the captain signals to his helmsman, who fires up the engine to join the hunt. A handler offers a tracker dog a sniff of clothing to renew its focus. Rambo runs through the undergrowth with a strip of Sarah's clothing on his boot, and the troops seem to be gaining on him as he runs through a carpet of dry brown leaves littering the forest floor. A lorry pulls into a clearing and more troops dismount, ready to expand the search. Rambo heads through the forest at full tilt, skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree historically known as a landmark for locals, where he takes the claymore explosive, a powerful directional mine, and launches it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and rips the clothing strip from his boot. He pulls a round metal disc, which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that he ties around the cloth, a tactic to create a decoy, and with another glance in the direction of the dogs, he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with leaves before taking off into the forest. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush, and a small dog with beady eyes, tan fur, and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns, causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree, where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile, a relic from a forgotten era, is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch, prompting the wide-eyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

Lewis treads on a hidden land mine and Diaz clamps a hand over his mouth as more troops dismount from the back of the lorry. The lorry moves on. Louis is wideeyed in shock as Diaz whispers to him while Reese looks about. Michael cuts at the bloody wound and Louis bites on a cloth. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. The commander's truck stops and via a walkietalkie the commander screams orders at an armed patrol boat on the river. The grey patrol boat flies the Burmese flag and the captain signals to his helmsman who fires up the engine. A handler offers a tracker dog a sniff of clothing. Rambo runs through the undergrowth with a strip of Sarah's clothing on his boot and the troops seem to be gaining on him as he runs through a carpet of dry brown leaves. A lorry pulls into a clearing and more troops dismount. Rambo heads through the forest at full tilt skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree where he takes the claymore explosive and launches it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and rips the clothing strip from his boot. He pulls a round metal disc which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that he ties around the cloth and with another glance in the direction of the dogs he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with leaves before taking off into the forest. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush and a small dog with beady eyes tan fur and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch prompting the wideeyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. The commander's truck stops and via a walkietalkie the commander screams orders at an armed patrol boat on the river. The grey patrol boat flies the Burmese flag and the captain signals to his helmsman who fires up the engine. A handler offers a tracker dog a sniff of clothing. Rambo runs through the undergrowth with a strip of Sarah's clothing on his boot and the troops seem to be gaining on him as he runs through a carpet of dry brown leaves. A lorry pulls into a clearing and more troops dismount. Rambo heads through the forest at full tilt skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree where he takes the claymore explosive and launches it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and rips the clothing strip from his boot. He pulls a round metal disc which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that he ties around the cloth and with another glance in the direction of the dogs he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with leaves before taking off into the forest. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush and a small dog with beady eyes tan fur and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch prompting the wideeyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: They head into the forest and BN now leads the escapees as they mount a rise. Lewis treads on a hidden land mine and Diaz clamps a hand over his mouth as more troops dismount from the back of the lorry. The lorry moves on. Louis is wideeyed in shock as Diaz whispers to him while Reese looks about. Michael cuts at the bloody wound and Louis bites on a cloth. Rambo heads through the forest at full tilt skidding to a halt beside a gnarled tree where he takes the claymore explosive and launches it in the limbs of the roots. He glances in the direction of his pursuers and rips the clothing strip from his boot. He pulls a round metal disc which is fastened to the body of the mine by a piece of twine that he ties around the cloth and with another glance in the direction of the dogs he pulls a priming pin from the bomb and covers the explosive with leaves before taking off into the forest. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush and a small dog with beady eyes tan fur and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch prompting the wideeyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: They head into the forest and BN now leads the escapees as they mount a rise. Lewis treads on a hidden land mine and Diaz clamps a hand over his mouth as more troops dismount from the back of the lorry. The dogs and their handlers halt by the bush and a small dog with beady eyes tan fur and a white beard sniffs around leaves and ferns causing the handlers to look at each other. One of the soldiers looks along the tree where the rusty grey shape of the Tall Boy Missile is lodged in the ground and leaning against the branch prompting the wideeyed and terrified handlers to quickly pull the excited dogs away as a soldier kneels to inspect the ground.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffes saunter into the desert, and QT now guides the jugglers as they scale a dune. Marvin steps on a hidden jellybean, and Carmen clamps a hand over his ear as more caterpillars slide from the back of the tricycle. The tricycle rolls on. Marvin is wide-eyed in mirth as Carmen hums to him while Tina glances around. Greg scribbles at the glowing laptop, and Marvin munches on a pancake. Clowns hop off a tricycle with the dancing camels, which are set after the tune and they guide their magicians in a raucous jig, followed by a large troupe of their comrades. Blinky, Emily, and Paper Boy skip up a sandy slope, but Emily tumbles in the sand, prompting Blinky to skip back to aid her while Paper Boy bounces ahead. Greg and the jesters haul Marvin on a haphazardly-built wagon, and the camels guide their magicians. On the sandy trail, Paper Boy halts to hum in a sandy alcove as Blinky begins to tear a patch from Emily's scarf, which he ties around his umbrella. Paper Boy flings Blinky a firecracker while Marvin's crew gazes in amazement. The jester's skateboard halts, and via a megaphone, the jester shouts requests at a colorful parade float on the highway. The pink parade float flies the Antarctic flag, and the captain gestures to his sidekick, who cranks up the stereo. A magician offers a dancing camel a sniff of pastry. Blinky skips through the bushes with a patch of Emily's scarf on his umbrella, and the clowns seem to be closing in on him as he skips through a blanket of dry orange petals. A tricycle pulls into a garden and more clowns hop off. Blinky skips through the desert at full speed, skidding to a stop beside a twisted cactus where he flings the firecracker into the branches. He peeks in the direction of his chasers and rips the scarf patch from his umbrella. He tugs a square wooden tile, which is fastened to the face of the firecracker by a piece of yarn that he ties around the scarf, and with another peek in the direction of the camels, he yanks a starter pin from the firecracker and covers it with petals before dashing into the desert. The camels and their magicians pause by the shrub, and a small camel with curious eyes, spotted fur, and a fluffy mane sniffs around petals and cacti, causing the magicians to glance at one another. One of the clowns stares along the cactus, where the rusty pink outline of the Giant Kite is perched in the sand and leaning against the shrub, prompting the wide-eyed and giggling magicians to swiftly tug the curious camels away as a clown crouches to inspect the sand.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: BN leads the escapees into the forest. Lewis steps on a land mine, and Diaz silences him as troops dismount from a lorry. The lorry moves on while Michael treats Lewis's wound. Soldiers with tracker dogs pursue them rapidly. Rambo, Sarah, and School Boy climb a rocky slope, but Sarah stumbles, and Rambo helps her. Michael and the mercenaries carry Lewis on a stretcher. The commander orders an armed patrol boat on the river into action. Rambo uses a strip from Sarah's shirt to mislead the dogs. He plants a claymore explosive near a tree and covers it with leaves before fleeing. The dogs and handlers halt, a soldier notices a Tall Boy Missile, and the terrified handlers pull back the dogs as a soldier inspects the area.
